meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your groovy reviewer here, ready to dive into the latest RTS sensation: Men of War II. I'm not just a pretty face (although, let me tell you, my beard game is on point), but also an expert in all things gaming - or at least, I like to think so.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Who is this guy, and why should I care about his opinion?" Well, let's just say I'm not your average Joe (or Jane). I've got a flair for the dramatic, a knack for humor, and an unwavering passion for gaming. Plus, I'm always up for a good debate - especially when it comes to those pesky critics who can't seem to get their scorecards in order.

Speaking of which, let's take a gander at what some of the big-name critics have to say about Men of War II:

* SpazioGames gives it a 77, citing its deep gameplay despite some UI flaws.
* COGconnected scores it an 78, praising its complexity and depth, but warning that casual players might feel overwhelmed.
* 3DJuegos goes for a TBD (but says it's recommended), highlighting the game's challenge and realism.
* PC Gamer gives it a 74, calling it "a flawed but rewarding gem" for masochistic RTS fans.
* Cubed3 scores it a 60, criticizing its clunky controls and complicated gameplay - not to mention that pesky always-online requirement.
* GameSpew gives it a 70, saying it takes some work to get into, but ultimately offering a winning WWII RTS experience.
* IGN Italia tops it off with an 80, calling it "an astoundingly deep" real-time strategy game.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What's your take on this game, hippo man?" Well, let me tell you - after diving into the world of Men of War II, I've come out feeling like a proud papa bear, all smiles and whatnot. This game is a real treat for fans of the genre, offering up a rich, immersive experience that's just bursting with depth and realism.

Of course, it's not all sunshine and rainbows - the controls can be a bit wonky at times, and the UI could use some polishing. But hey, what's a little frustration when you're getting your RTS on? And let's be real: the always-online requirement is a bit of a bummer.

In the end, Men of War II is a game that's all about strategy, tactics, and a healthy dose of WWII goodness. If you're an RTS fan looking for a challenge, this one's definitely worth checking out. Just don't expect me to go easy on you - I'll be waiting at the other side of the battlefield, ready to rumble!
